comment.author: 99500904@N07
comment._content: Central of HK, the church is still there now

comment.author: 99505116@N07
comment._content: The Parade Ground was still there when our family arrived in 58.  At that time it was being used as a carpark.  However a few years later the Hong Kong Hilton Hotel was built on it

comment.author: 61013804@N08
comment._content: The church is St John's Cathedral. The building in front of it is the French Foreign Mission, which is now the Court of Final Appeal. sandywhite49 was correct that the lawn in front is the parade ground. Hilton Hotel just took up part of it. The remaining part is the Cricket Club, which is now the Chater Garden.
